page.title: 04Fermyn Woods Hall - History
page.content: Situated about a mile from the village of Brigstock,dates from the 14th century and was added to until the 19th century. The house was originally built for the Head Archer of the Brigstock parish in Rockingham forest. Later it was presented by Queen Elizabeth I to{Sir Christopher Hatton as a shooting box. It passed on to the Lyveden family and was sold in 1925 to Capt. Belville. During the 1939-45 war the Hall was home for evacuees from london. The grounds of the hall are loaned for the Brigstock Horse Trials prior to the Badminton Horse Trials. In the 18 and 19 C many changes were made, the gateway came from{Lyveden {Old Bield}and bears the name of Lewis {Tresham.}The garden has a pond with wild ducks, the fences are used as jumps for the trials and the hall has 7 habitable bedrooms & 5 bathrooms
